meanings.sent1: Her misbelief in ghosts made her scared of the dark.
meanings.sent2: His misbelief that he could fly led to a dangerous situation.
meanings.sent3: The misbelief that cats have nine lives is just a silly superstition.
meanings.sent4: The misbelief that money grows on trees can lead to financial trouble.
meanings.sent5: The misbelief that eating carrots improves eyesight is a common myth.

meanings.definition: The act of holding a false or mistaken belief.
meanings.sent1: The misbelief of the students that the test was canceled caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: His misbelief in his own abilities held him back from trying new things.
meanings.sent3: The misbelief that the moon is made of cheese is a funny misconception.
meanings.sent4: The misbelief that success comes overnight can be damaging to one's goals.
meanings.sent5: The misbelief that all snakes are venomous is a dangerous assumption.
